author: saravananVCK
body:
Facing issues in Poweshell installation in Mac OSX.

Unable to work connect or login in azure powershell.
We followed the Microsoft reference document and installed azure powershell successfully (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/setup/installing-powershell-core-on-macos?view=powershell-6). But we couldn't able to proceed further on Azure powershell.

we are facing lot challenges while working on Mac OSX Azure powershell, Few are listed below.
Please assist on this issues asap.


```
PS /Users/karuppis> Connect-AzureRmAccount 
Connect-AzureRmAccount : The term 'Connect-AzureRmAccount' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program. Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again. At line:1 char:1 + Connect-AzureRmAccount + ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ + CategoryInfo : ObjectNotFound: (Connect-AzureRmAccount:String) [], CommandNotFoundException + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException 8:46 PM

PS /Users/karuppis> Get-AzureRmEnrollmentAccount 
Get-AzureRmEnrollmentAccount : The Azure PowerShell session has not been properly initialized. Please import the module and try again. At line:1 char:1 + Get-AzureRmEnrollmentAccount + ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ + CategoryInfo : NotSpecified: (:) [Get-AzureRmEnrollmentAccount], InvalidOperationException + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.InvalidOperationException,Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Billing.Cmdlets.EnrollmentAccounts.GetAzureRmEnrollmentAccount 8:47 PM
PS /Users/karuppis> get-modules -listavailable 
get-modules : The term 'get-modules' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program. Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again. At line:1 char:1 + get-modules -listavailable + ~~~~~~~~~~~ + CategoryInfo : ObjectNotFound: (get-modules:String) [], CommandNotFoundException + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException 
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
PSCore6 doesn't include the Azure cmdlets.  You must install it yourself:

```powershell
install-module AzureRM.Netcore -Scope CurrentUser
```

title: Powershell Core installation for Mac OSX
